content.description: Start on some holds of choice and go straight up.  Yeah, yeah, I know it's a bad description but if you look at the photo, it'll show it all quite well.
content.location: On the left face of the undercut boulder.

content.description: The direct version of "Flexitarian Poser".  Start to the left of the arete on the boulder and clib straight up.
Sit start at the bottom of the arete of the 50 degree overhang.  Climb the arete and when you hit the lip pull through on the right side of the arete.
content.location: The arete on the 50 degree overhanging boulder.

content.description: Sit Start with holds at waist height (while standing).  Climb straight up and top out.
content.location: To the right and slightly in front of the Golden Boulder.

content.description: The sit start to "Dance Burrito".  Starts with the same left hand side pull as "Dance Burrito" but starts with the right hand on the arete as another sidepull.
content.location: The arete of the boulder that leans against the 50 degree overhanging boulder to the right.

content.description: Slab climb, sit start with right hand on crimp and left hand on something.  Go straight up and top out.
content.location: Left face of the undercut boulder.

content.description: Sit start with hands on holds just to the right of the tree in front of the boulder.  Traverse right while climbing slightly up and finish on "Swabbie".
content.location: To the right of and further down the hill from "Choss Blocker".

content.description: Sit Start and grab onto whatever is in reach.  Go straight up and top out.
content.location: Same boulder as "Sea of Bees".  To the right.

content.description: Stand start with left hand in a side pull and right hand on a decent full pad crimp.  Climb up the arete and top out.  Landing zone is a little wonky so make sure you have good pad placement.
content.location: The arete of the boulder that leans against the 50 degree overhanging boulder on to the right.

content.description: Starts on the same jug ledge as "Choss Blocker", but instead of traversing out right, immediately go up and top out.
content.protection: A single pad at the most.
content.location: Same start as "Choss Blocker" on the left of the undercut boulder.

content.description: Start sitting and with hands matched in the jug ledge.  Traverse right along slopey crimps and pinches until about 2/3 of the way across the boulder.  Make your way up using a super high toe hook beta or some other beta and top out.  Note, the detached rock under the undercut is off route.
content.protection: No pads, good chance of dabbing if you use one.  Landing zone is safe enough that it is not needed.
content.location: Starts on under the undercut to the left.

content.description: Yeah it's a super easy climb... but can you do it without hands?

Amazing line that starts in the middle of the 50 degree overhang.  Start matched on the white streak of quartz and traverse left until reaching about 2ft from the arete and then head up and top out.  The arete is off route.  The lip is off route until reaching the spot shown in the photos.
content.location: The middle of the 50 degree overhang.

content.description: Sit start with left hand in a crimp and right hand on a jug where you can also place a good heel hook to start the route.  Climb straight up and top out.
content.protection: A single pad at the most.
content.location: To the right of the undercut boulder.  This is on a different boulder and is about 30 degrees overhanging.

content.description: This area is noted by the beautiful 50 degree overhanging boulder.  The climbs in this area cover more than just the overhanging boulder.  Since this area is comprised of a bunch of boulders, the left to right will be when you are looking uphill at the boulders and it will start with the furthest left boulder, give all the climbs on that one and then move to the next boulder and repeat.  I am working on making a topo for the area but want to get more of the boulders established before it's done.  Once it's done it'll be posted on the main page for Crescent Boulders.
